title: (x) Luke Inglis "Out of this world" album cover - ITC Avant Garde Gothic, Jey {Rainer, Jan Erdmann}
content:
Hi.

Can somebody ID this font for me please? Cheers.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [luke2.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017181453/http:/typophile.com/files/luke2.jpg) | 160.3 KB |

 [‹ U.S. Dollar Typeface? Help please :)](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017181453/http:/typophile.com/node/33117 "Go to previous forum topic") [weird "m" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017181453/http:/typophile.com/node/33131 "Go to next forum topic")
author: stupid_child

comments.content: Avant Garde and Cezanne. Nope not Cezanne.

You could approximate the script with [Velda](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017181453/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/richard_beatty/velda/&sample_text=Out%20of%20this%20world%20&sample_size=48).

I knew I’ve seen it:

[Jey](http://web.archive.org/web/20071017181453/http:/www.dafont.com/jey.font?nb_ppp=50&af=on&text=Out+of+this+world) by Cuttyfruity. Is this the original?
It looks like the real deal — this can’t be anything but a freeware font. It’s not very good, isn’t it?
Well it does what it has to do. It looks like … ahum … handwritten. Amateurish, right. Not written by a professional calligrapher, but, hmm, isn’t that the purpose?
